title: Land mines return to Europe as front-line states fear Russian invasion
description: As policymakers reckon with Russia’s advances in Ukraine and Trump’s comments about defending NATO, the tools of 20th-century warfare are coming back in vogue.

title: Frontline Ukrainian commander pleads with Senate leader Schumer for aid
description: The Senate majority leader was in western Ukraine on an official visit when a phone interview with the Post turned into a conversation with the head of a drone unit desperately short of ammunition.

title: Russian authorities threaten to bury Navalny in prison colony, aide says
description: The Russian opposition leader’s mother, Lyudmila Navalnaya, is rejecting a demand that she hold a small, private funeral for her son, who died suddenly in prison last week.

title: Netanyahu presents hard-line ‘day after’ vision for Gaza for the first time
description: The new plan, which came as a surprise, reflects Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s views on the conflict and has been dismissed by the Palestinians as a reoccupation of the Gaza Strip.

title: Scientists have studied a peculiar fossil since 1931. It was a fake.
description: European researchers said in a new study that a vital reptile fossil believed to be about 280 million years old was forged with paint.

title: Fewer migrants are crossing into Texas. Gov. Abbott is claiming credit.
description: Illegal border crossings into the United States have fallen 50 percent since the end of December

title: Two years of war in Ukraine, seen through its leader’s biggest moments
description: Since Russia invaded Ukraine two years ago, Volodymyr Zelensky has stayed, fought, cajoled and pleaded for his country. Here are the most important moments.

title: For Russian political prisoners, Navalny’s death is reminder of peril
description: Russia’s political prisoners realize — more than ever after the death of opposition leader Alexei Navalny — their lives are at constant risk in penal colonies.

title: Five maps show where the war in Ukraine stands after two years
description: Attacks including missile strikes, drone strikes and shelling by Ukrainians and Russians remain concentrated in the same general areas as at the end of 2022. But the fighting has intensified.

title: Here’s why China is sending pandas back to the United States
description: As U.S.-China relations have soured, Beijing has been calling home the pandas it loaned to American zoos. Until now. San Diego could soon have some new bears.

title: By bus, car and plane, women journey across Latin America for abortions
description: Hundreds and perhaps thousands of Brazilians travel abroad to get abortions in other Latin American countries that allow the procedure.

title: Middle East conflict live updates: UNRWA head says agency has hit ‘breaking point’ after funding freezes
description: UNRWA chief Philippe Lazzarini said $450 million in funding was paused in the wake of Israel’s allegations that some of its staff took part in the Oct. 7 attack.

title: Sudanese militiamen carry out wave of abductions, seeking slaves and ransom
description: The Rapid Support Forces, headed by Hemedti, are accused by witnesses and activists of kidnapping civilians, including young women for sale as sex slaves.

title: In Ukraine and Gaza, twilight for the ‘rules-based order’
description: Western leaders may see in Ukraine the defense of the “rules-based order” against Russian brutishness, but in the ongoing calamity in Gaza, it’s easy to also see its breakdown.

title: Mexican president lashes out after reports of drug cartel investigations
description: The report, which said U.S. agents had investigated possible ties between the president’s aides and drug traffickers, comes at a delicate time in U.S.-Mexico relations.
